reviews.review_msg: I took ENGL 437 "Seminar in American Literatures" with Jon at SFU. One time, 3/4 of the class didnt do the reading and he got really mad. He yelled at the class "DO THE F****** READINGS!!" . Jon is arrogant and embodies the big-brained prof stereotype. Take his course for the credit, he's also an easy marker, but character-wise -- poor.

Jon was great. He made you work for your grade, but if you attended class and followed what he wanted you to watch/read, the tasks were super easy. What I liked about him was that he was personable both in the classroom and during office hours. He wants to see his students succeed so pushes them. Take his class if you really wanna delve into lit.

As far as quality professors go, Jon ranks among the best. He has a vast knowledge of his field and is able to take a natural approach to teaching. This involves occasionally going on "rants", but he keeps class lectures entertaining and informative. I would reccomend him to students willing to work hard, and improve in this subject.

Jon is one of the most consistenly entertaining profs I've had at SFU. He's ridiculously knowledgable and good at creating dialogue. He also has a very funny sarcastic sense of humour that, unfortunately, seemed to irritate those with entitlement complexes. Worth taking for sure.

He's a nice enough guy, but it often seems like he hasn't thought through his lectures beforehand, so sometimes they're tangential and dense. Even though it's a 4th year course, seminars are much more like lectures.

This was a great class and the prof was excellent.  Smith is an engaging lecturer and has a positive and helpful attitude towards his students.  The class is a lot of work but its worth the effort.  Smith is the best instructor I have ever had.
